sub_title: Independent consultant on M&E, conflict prevention, peacebuilding and security
summary:
Independent consultant with over 15 years professional experience in the field of international conflict prevention and management, peacebuilding and security in fragile and conflict-affected environments. Extensive experience in design, monitoring and evaluation (M&E) of peacebuilding programmes.

Key thematic areas of interest and expertise:
•	Conflict prevention, conflict management, peacebuilding, security, stabilisation
•	Counter terrorism and preventing / countering violent extremism (CT-P/CVE)
•	Justice and security sector reform, mediation, governance, development

Extensive experience in providing the following types of consulting services:
•	Technical assistance in design, formulation/identification, implementation, monitoring and evaluation (M&E) of projects and programmes 
•	Evaluations, appraisals, reviews, strategic assessments
•	Development of systems / frameworks for M&E (and Learning & Adaptation) for projects/programmes
•	Conflict analysis and conflict sensitivity guidance
•	Research and analysis, policy advice

In-country work experience: Albania, Bahrain, Bosnia Herzegovina, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cambodia, Chad, DR Congo, Cote d'Ivoire, Ethiopia, Georgia, Ghana, Indonesia, Iraq, Israel, Jordan, Kazakhstan, Kenya, Kyrgyzstan, Lebanon, Maldives, Mozambique, Nepal, Nigeria, Pakistan, Palestine, Rwanda, Senegal, South Africa, South Sudan, Sudan, Thailand, Tunisia, Turkey, Uganda, Ukraine, Yemen (remote), Zimbabwe.

Able to work in English, Dutch and French-speaking environments.

projects:
[{'title': 'Monitoring and Evaluation Support Services to the Instrument Contributing to Stability and Peace', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'description': 'Team Leader for ‘IcSP support services project’, managed by Transtec that focuses on two main areas of support:
(1)	In-field support services to be provided across 14 requested field visits from EUDs between July 2014 and September 2015. In some cases this may include more than one visit to particular projects. 
(2)	A meta-analysis of up to 30 existing mid-term and final evaluations of IcSP projects to map out learning and implications on specific themes and approaches across the range of projects. This is with the view of helping current and future projects and to establish an organisational learning base to assist FPI, EUDs and implementing partners in the design, implementation and measurement of results for such projects.
